text: From Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Yeshua Christ. I was sent to lead God’s chosen people to faith and to the knowledge of the truth that leads to a godly life.
speaker: Narrator

text: My message is based on the confidence of eternal life. God, who never lies, promised this eternal life before the world began.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has revealed this in every era by spreading his word. I was entrusted with this word by the command of God our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Titus, a genuine child in the faith we share.
Good will and peace from God the Father and from Christ Yeshua our Savior are yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: I left you in Crete to do what still needed to be done—appointing spiritual leaders in every city as I directed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: A spiritual leader must have a good reputation. He must have only one wife and have children who are believers. His children shouldn’t be known for having wild lifestyles or being rebellious.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because a bishop is a supervisor appointed by God, he must have a good reputation. He must not be a stubborn or irritable person. He must not drink too much or be a violent person. He must not use shameful ways to make money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, he must be hospitable, love what is good, use good judgment, be fair and moral, and have self-control.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must be devoted to the trustworthy message we teach. Then he can use these accurate teachings to encourage people and correct those who oppose the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many believers, especially converts from Judaism, who are rebellious. They speak nonsense and deceive people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must be silenced because they are ruining whole families by teaching what they shouldn’t teach. This is the shameful way they make money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even one of their own prophets said, “Cretans are always liars, savage animals, and lazy gluttons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That statement is true. For this reason, sharply correct believers so that they continue to have faith that is alive and well.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouldn’t pay attention to Jewish myths or commands given by people who are always rejecting the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything is clean to those who are clean. But nothing is clean to corrupt unbelievers. Indeed, their minds and their consciences are corrupted.
speaker: Narrator

text: They claim to know God, but they deny him by what they do. They are detestable, disobedient, and unfit to do anything good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell believers to live the kind of life that goes along with accurate teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell older men to be sober. Tell them to be men of good character, to use good judgment, and to be well-grounded in faith, love, and endurance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell older women to live their lives in a way that shows they are dedicated to God. Tell them not to be gossips or addicted to alcohol, but to be examples of virtue.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way they will teach young women to show love to their husbands and children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to use good judgment, and to be morally pure. Also, tell them to teach young women to be homemakers, to be kind, and to place themselves under their husbands’ authority. Then no one can speak evil of God’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Encourage young men to use good judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Always set an example by doing good things. When you teach, be an example of moral purity and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak an accurate message that cannot be condemned. Then those who oppose us will be ashamed because they cannot say anything bad about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell slaves who are believers to place themselves under their masters’ authority in everything they do. Tell them to please their masters, not to argue with them
speaker: Narrator

text: or steal from them. Instead, tell slaves to show their masters how good and completely loyal they can be. Then they will show the beauty of the teachings about God our Savior in everything they do.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, God’s saving kindness has appeared for the benefit of all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: It trains us to avoid ungodly lives filled with worldly desires so that we can live self-controlled, moral, and godly lives in this present world.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time we can expect what we hope for—the appearance of the glory of our great God and Savior, Yeshua Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave himself for us to set us free from every sin and to cleanse us so that we can be his special people who are enthusiastic about doing good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell these things to the believers. Encourage and correct them, using your full authority. Don’t let anyone ignore you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remind believers to willingly place themselves under the authority of government officials. Believers should obey them and be ready to help them with every good thing they do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Believers shouldn’t curse anyone or be quarrelsome, but they should be gentle and show courtesy to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, we, too, were once stupid, disobedient, and misled. We were slaves to many kinds of lusts and pleasures. We were mean and jealous. We were hated, and we hated each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, when God our Savior made his kindness and love for humanity appear,
speaker: Narrator

text: he saved us, but not because of anything we had done to gain his approval. Instead, because of his mercy he saved us through the washing in which the Holy Spirit gives us new birth and renewal.
speaker: Narrator

text: God poured a generous amount of the Spirit on us through Yeshua Christ our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, God in his kindness has given us his approval and we have become heirs who have the confidence that we have everlasting life.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a statement that can be trusted. I want you to insist on these things so that those who believe in God can concentrate on setting an example by doing good things. This is good and helps other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid foolish controversies, arguments about genealogies, quarrels, and fights about Moses’ Teachings. This is useless and worthless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have nothing to do with people who continue to teach false doctrine after you have warned them once or twice.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that people like this are corrupt. They are sinners condemned by their own actions.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, hurry to visit me in the city of Nicopolis. I have decided to spend the winter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give Zenas the lawyer and Apollos your best support for their trip so that they will have everything they need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our people should also learn how to set an example by doing good things when urgent needs arise so that they can live productive lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet our faithful friends.
God’s good will be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator
